hypothesis: Start with large popsize (12) for exploration in first 60% of feval budget, then reduce to default (6) for exploitation. Inverse of IPOP.

tuning_runs.notes: MASSIVE FAILURE - 2.1x over budget, -0.17 score vs baseline. Two-phase CMA-ES creates 8 CMA-ES runs per 2-source sample.

issues_identified: 1. Two phases = 2x CMA-ES runs per init (4 inits * 2 phases = 8 CMA-ES for 2-source)
2. Implementation gives FULL feval budget to each init (should divide)
3. CMA-ES covariance adaptation requires continuous updates - phases break this
4. Phase 1 doesn't converge (large popsize = fewer generations)
5. Phase 2 starts fresh with bad covariance

comparison_to_prior.IPOP: IPOP also failed - restarts don't help when no local optima to escape
comparison_to_prior.larger_popsize: Popsize=12 alone failed (73 min). Phases make it worse (125 min)

final_analysis.skip_further_tuning_reason: Run 1 failure so severe (2x budget, -0.17 score) that no tuning can recover. Fundamental approach is wrong.
